009
010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012import java.util.Locale;
013
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015
016/**
017 * This class represents complex numbers. Instances are immutable.
018 * Methods are mostly defined to be compatible with 
019 * org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex and (newer)
020 * org.apache.commons.numbers.complex.Complex.
021 * Arithmetic operations are generally more precise than with the
022 * Apache implementation.
023 * 
024 * @author W. Burger
025 * @version 2020/11/20
026 */
027public class Complex {
028        
029        /** Real unit value (z = 1 + i 0). */
030        public static final Complex ONE = new Complex(1, 0);
031        /** Complex zero value (z = 0 + i 0). */
032        public static final Complex ZERO = new Complex(0, 0);
033        /** Imaginary unit value (z = 0 + i 1). */
034        public static final Complex I = new Complex(0, 1);
035
036        /** The real part of this complex number */
037        public final double re;
038        /** The imaginary part of this complex number */
039        public final double im;
040
041        /**
042         * Constructor.
043         * @param re real part
044         * @param im imaginary part
045         */
046        public Complex(double re, double im) {
047                this.re = re;
048                this.im = im;
049        }
050
051        /**
052         * Constructor
053         * @param z complex quantity, which is duplicated
054         */
055        public Complex(Complex z) {
056                this.re = z.re;
057                this.im = z.im;
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * Create a complex quantity on the unit circle with angle 'phi':
062         * e^{\i \phi} = \cos(\phi) + \i \cdot \sin(\phi)
063         * @param phi angle
064         */
065        public Complex(double phi) {
066                this.re = Math.cos(phi);
067                this.im = Math.sin(phi);
068        }
069        
070        
071        public Complex(Pnt2d pnt) {
072                this.re = pnt.getX();
073                this.im = pnt.getY();
074        }
075        
076        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
077
078        /**
079         * Returns the absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
080         * its radius or distance from the origin.
081         * @return the absolute value
082         */
083        public double abs() {
084                return Math.sqrt(this.abs2());
085        }
086
087        /**
088         * Returns the squared absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
089         * its squared radius or distance from the origin.
090         * @return the squared absolute value
091         */
092        public double abs2() {
093                return re * re + im * im;
094        }
095
096        /**
097         * Returns the 'argument' of this complex number, i.e.,
098         * its angle relative to the real axis. 
099         * @return the argument (in radians)
100         */
101        public double arg() {
102                return Math.atan2(im, re);
103        }
104
105        /**
106     * Returns the conjugate {@code z*} of this complex number, i.e,
107     * if {@code z = a + i b} then {@code z* = a - i b}.
108     * @return the complex conjugate
109     */
110        public Complex conjugate() {
111                return new Complex(this.re, -this.im);
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * Adds a complex quantity to this complex number and returns
116         * a new complex number.
117         * @param z complex value
118         * @return the sum of this complex number and {@code z}
119         */
120        public Complex add(Complex z) {
121                return new Complex(this.re + z.re,  this.im + z.im);
122        }
123
124        /**
125         * Rotates this complex number by the angle {@code phi} and returns
126         * a new complex number.
127         * @param phi the angle (in radians)
128         * @return the rotated complex value
129         */
130        public Complex rotate(double phi) {
131                return this.multiply(new Complex(phi));
132        }
133
134        @Override
135    public String toString() {
136        return String.format(Locale.US, "(%.9f, %.9f)", re, im);
137    }
138        
139    /**
140     * Returns true if the real or imaginary component of this complex number
141     * is {@code NaN}.
142     * @return true if {@code NaN}, otherwise false
143     */
144        public boolean isNaN() {
145                return Double.isNaN(this.getRe()) || Double.isNaN(this.getIm());
146        }
147        
148        /**
149         * Returns the real part of this complex number.
150         * @return the real part
151         */
152        public double getRe() {
153                return this.re;
154        }
155        
156        /**
157         * Returns the imaginary part of this complex number.
158         * @return the imaginary part
159         */
160        public double getIm() {
161                return this.im;
162        }
163
164        /**
165         * Multiplies this complex number with another complex quantity {@code z2} and returns
166         * a new complex number.
167         * @param z2 a complex quantity
168         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code z2}
169         */
170        public Complex multiply(Complex z2) {
171                // (x1 + i y1)(x2 + i y2) = (x1 x2 + y1 y2) + i (x1 y2 + y1 x2)
172                Complex z1 = this;
173                double x = z1.re * z2.re - z1.im * z2.im;
174                double y = z1.re * z2.im + z1.im * z2.re;
175                return new Complex(x, y);
176        }
177        
178        /**
179         * Multiplies this complex number with the scalar factor {@code s} and returns
180         * a new complex number.
181         * @param s a scalar factor
182         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code s}
183         */
184        public Complex multiply(double s) {
185                return new Complex(this.re * s, this.im * s);
186        }
187        
188         /**
189     * Returns of value of this complex number raised to the power of {@code k}.
190     * @param k the exponent
191     * @return {@code z^k}
192     */
193        public Complex pow(int k) {
194                if (k < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("exponent k >= 0 expected");
195                Complex prod = new Complex(1, 0);
196                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
197                        prod = prod.multiply(this);
198                }
199                return prod;
200        }
201        
202        /**
203         * Returns a 2-element array with the real and imaginary part of this
204         * complex number.
205         * @return (re, im)
206         */
207        public double[] toArray() {
208                return new double[] {this.re, this.im};
209        }
210        
211        @Override
212        public boolean equals(Object o) {
213        if (o == this) {
214            return true;
215        }       
216        if (o instanceof Complex) {
217                final Complex c = (Complex) o;
218                return Double.compare(this.re, c.re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, c.im) == 0;
219        }
220        return false;
221        }
222        
223        public boolean equals(double a, double b) {
224                return Double.compare(this.re, a) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, b) == 0;
225        }
226
227        //------------ TESTING only ------------------------------
228
229//      public static void main(String[] args) {
230//              Complex z1 = new Complex(0.3, 0.6);
231//              Complex z2 = new Complex(-1, 0.2);
232//              
233//              System.out.println("z1 = " + z1);
234//              System.out.println("z2 = " + z2);
235//              
236//              System.out.println("z1 + z2 = " + z1.add(z2));
237//              System.out.println("z2 + z1 = " + z2.add(z1));
238//              
239//              
240//              System.out.println("z1 = " + z1);
241//              System.out.println("z2 = " + z2);
242//              Complex z3 = z1.multiply(z2);
243//              System.out.println("z1 * z2 = " + z3);
244//              Complex z4 = z2.multiply(z1);
245//              System.out.println("z2 * z1 = " + z4);
246//              
247//              System.out.println("z1.pow(5) = " + z1.pow(5));
248//              
249//              System.out.println("z1.rotate(0.1) = " + z1.rotate(0.1));
250//      }
251
252}
253/*
254z1 = (0.300000000, 0.600000000)
255z2 = (-1.000000000, 0.200000000)
256z1 + z2 = (-0.700000000, 0.800000000)
257z2 + z1 = (-0.700000000, 0.800000000)
258z1 = (0.300000000, 0.600000000)
259z2 = (-1.000000000, 0.200000000)
260z1 * z2 = (-0.420000000, -0.540000000)
261z2 * z1 = (-0.420000000, -0.540000000)
262z1.pow(5) = (0.099630000, -0.092340000)
263z1.rotate(0.1) = (0.238601200, 0.626952524)
264*/
